meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reserved or uncommunicative in speech
meanings.sent1: Her taciturnity in class made it hard for others to get to know her.
meanings.sent2: His taciturnity at the party was mistaken for aloofness.
meanings.sent3: Despite his taciturnity, he had a great sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The old house exuded a sense of taciturnity, as if holding onto its secrets.
meanings.sent5: The taciturnity of the mountains at night was both eerie and peaceful.

meanings.definition: A disposition to silence or uncommunicativeness
meanings.sent1: The child's taciturnity worried his parents, who wanted him to open up more.
meanings.sent2: Her taciturnity in meetings often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: Despite his taciturnity, he was a great listener.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured a moment of taciturnity, frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The taciturnity of the library was broken only by the turning of pages.
